announcements.title: Circular 032
announcements.subtitle: Semester fees payment
content: HODs of all departments and tutors are requested to instruct the students to pay their current semester fee through online in any bank on, or before July 31, 2024, without fine.

announcements.title: Circular 060
announcements.subtitle: Holiday for UG first-years
content: Greetings from Hindusthan College of Arts & Science!
Happy Aadiperukku to all!

This is to bring to notice that, first-year UG students are hereby instructed to go and collect their original marksheets from their respective schools on August 05, 2024, and submit the same to the admission office on August 06, 2024, without fail.
August 05, 2024, will be a holiday for all first-year UG students.

announcements.title: Circular 061
announcements.subtitle: Disaster fund
content: In response to the massive landslides that struck Wayanad, on July 30, 2024, our college is mobilizing funds to support those affected by this tragic disaster.
The magnitude of this disaster has caused an immediate need for essential supplies and support.
Interested faculties / students can contribute to the relief fund.
The class tutors are asked to collect money from the students who are willing to contribute and maintain a name-list.
We urge everyone to contribute generously and assist in this crucial effort to save lives and aid recovery.
And, also asked to submit the collected money to the college fees counter.
Last date for submission: August 07, 2024.

announcements.title: Circular 087
announcements.subtitle: Welfare scholarship
content: Student are asked to apply for minority scholarship (Muslim, Parsi, Jain, Sikh, Buddhist, Christian) for the academic year 2024-2025.
Those who've failed to apply last year can apply for scholarship afresh this year through National Scholarship Portal.

Eligibility: income certificate (not exceeding 2 lakhs); community & nativity certificate; nationalized book account number, IFSC code, MICR number, Aadhaar card, bonafide certificate; for fresher: 50% of marks in grade 12, for renewal: 50% of marks in previous last 2 semester examinations
Details for fresh applications:
The scheme is implemented through online scholarship management (OSMS).
It's mandatory for all students to apply online. The students shall apply on the scholarship website.
After submitting applications online, the students will take print-out of the application and submit the same to the college, without fail.

One copy of passport-size photograph with student signature; one self-attested copy of certificates, diploma, degree, etc. in respect of examinations passed; income & nativity certificate issued by state-authorized officer; proof for religion / community / transfer / self-declaration of community by student; copy of bank pass book, copy of fees receipt; copy of address proof
The last date of renewal is September 30, 2024.
